page.title: 16Mount Pleasant farm survey
page.content: sheared around July. They buy and sell their cattle at Newport and Abergavenny Cattle Markets. A lamb at present fetches about Â£15, a young ewe about Â£20, a calf, Â£100, and a cow around Â£400 _ Â£450. They have a variety of machinery, Tractor, Bailer, Mower, Hay Bob and a Muck Spreader. They have several out _ buildings, including 1 barn, 2 cow sheds, 2 loose boxes, 1 stable, a chicken cot, a tool shed, an implement shed and a sheep dip which is used in July to kill ticks. All farms have vermin and Mount Pleasant is no exception with mice, foxes, stoats, weasels, rabbits and the occasional mole. Other animals are chickens and geese.
